TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ContentEncoding extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: An enumeration of all supported content transfer encodings. .
Docs.remarks: Some older mail software is unable to properly deal with data outside of the ASCII range, so it is sometimes necessary to encode the content of MIME entities.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding Base64 = int32(4)

Docs.remarks: This encoding is typically used for encoding binary data or textual content in a largely 8bit charset encoding and is supported by all message transport services.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding Binary = int32(3)

Docs.remarks: This encoding is simply unencoded binary data. Typically not supported by standard message transport services such as SMTP.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The default encoding (aka no encoding at all).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding EightBit = int32(2)

Docs.remarks: This encoding should be restricted to textual content outside of the US-ASCII range but may not be supported by all transport services such as older SMTP servers that do not support the 8BITMIME extension.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding QuotedPrintable = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The quoted printable content transfer encoding. .
Docs.remarks: This encoding is used for textual content that is in a charset that has a minority of characters outside of the US-ASCII range (such as ISO-8859-1 and other single-byte charset encodings) and is supported by all message transport services.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding SevenBit = int32(1)

Docs.remarks: This encoding should be restricted to textual content in the US-ASCII range.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype MimeKit.ContentEncoding UUEncode = int32(6)

Docs.remarks: This is an obsolete encoding meant for encoding binary data and has largely been superceeded by .
